title: Future Research Capacity Building in Education:Pilotting an All Wales Educational Research Network
abstractText:
The educational research infrastructure in Wales is deteriorating, in order to reverse this decline a systematic programme of research capacity building is required .Therefore the primary intention of the pilot is to trial a funding and support structure for educational researchers in Wales that harnesses collaboration between institutions to build research capacity.

During its first year, it is proposed that the core activity of the Wales Education Research Network will be the provision of bursaries and training support to cross-institutional groups of varied expertise to develop and submit bids for research funding. Contingent on successful evaluation, during its second year the collaborative research activity will be further developed and extended.Throughout the two year period, training and support mechanisms will be developed and implemented including:

  • mentor surgeries
  • a virtual learning environment and website
  • research colloquia and seminars.

The management and governance of the Network will be collaborative and comprise all Welsh higher education institutions.Evidence will gathered for an internal evaluation by recording and monitoring the outcomes of the Networkâ€™s activities, and by interviews with all participants to explore institutional participation and any emerging cross-institutional synergies. An external evaluation will also be commissioned from a critical friend from outside Wales.
